parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "SLURM",
  "details": {
    "memory": "246G",
    "nodes": 32,
    "tasks_per_node": 6,
    "cpus_per_task": 1,
    "partition": "cpu",
    "account": "bcfx-delta-cpu",
    "job_name": "th_new/hmg_ldc3d",
    "time": "2:00:00",
    "constraint": "scratch",
    "propagate": "STACK",
    "environment": {
      "OMP_NUM_THREADS": 1,
      "GCC_PATH": "/sw/spack/deltas11-2023-03/apps/linux-rhel8-x86_64/gcc-8.5.0/gcc-11.4.0-yycklku",
      "OMPI_PATH": "/sw/spack/deltas11-2023-03/apps/linux-rhel8-zen3/gcc-11.4.0/openmpi-4.1.6-lranp74",
      "LIBSTDC": "/sw/spack/deltas11-2023-03/apps/linux-rhel8-x86_64/gcc-8.5.0/gcc-11.4.0-yycklku/lib64",
      "PATH": "/sw/spack/deltas11-2023-03/apps/linux-rhel8-x86_64/gcc-8.5.0/gcc-11.4.0-yycklku/bin:/sw/spack/deltas11-2023-03/apps/linux-rhel8-zen3/gcc-11.4.0/openmpi-4.1.6-lranp74/bin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/bin:/bin",
      "LD_LIBRARY_PATH": "/sw/spack/deltas11-2023-03/apps/linux-rhel8-x86_64/gcc-8.5.0/gcc-11.4.0-yycklku/lib64:/sw/spack/deltas11-2023-03/apps/linux-rhel8-x86_64/gcc-8.5.0/gcc-11.4.0-yycklku/lib:/sw/spack/deltas11-2023-03/apps/linux-rhel8-zen3/gcc-11.4.0/openmpi-4.1.6-lranp74/lib:/usr/local/lib64:/usr/local/lib:/usr/lib64:/usr/lib",
      "FI_CXI_RX_MATCH_MODE": "software"
    },
    "modules": [
      "gcc/11.4.0",
      "openmpi/4.1.6"
    ],
    "python_environment": "/u/avoronin1/firedrake_metis/firedrake/bin/activate",
    "executable": "python ../solver.py 10 2 3"
  }
}
```

This script runs a Python script named `solver.py` using the SLURM job scheduler. It requests 246 GB of memory, 32 nodes, 6 tasks per node, and 1 CPU per task.  The script runs on the "cpu" partition and uses the "bcfx-delta-cpu" account. It specifies a job name, a runtime of 2 hours, and a constraint of "scratch". The script also propagates the STACK environment variable.

The script loads the `gcc/11.4.0` and `openmpi/4.1.6` modules and then activates a Python environment using the command `source /u/avoronin1/firedrake_metis/firedrake/bin/activate`. It also sets various environment variables related to GCC, OpenMPI, and the standard C library. 

Finally, the script runs the `solver.py` script with arguments `10 2 3` using the `srun` command, which executes a program on the compute nodes managed by SLURM.
